title: Sending Salawat
introduction: Sending blessings (salawat) upon Prophet Muhammad ﷺ is a beloved and rewarding act of worship in Islam. It connects our hearts to the Prophet, expresses our gratitude for his sacrifices, and brings countless blessings into our own lives. Allah and His angels send blessings upon him, and He commands the believers to do the same.

sections.heading: Meaning of Salawat
sections.content: Salawat means asking Allah to bless, honor, and raise the status of the Prophet Muhammad ﷺ and his family. It is a way of acknowledging his role as the final Messenger and expressing our love and respect for him. Sending salawat reminds us of his guidance and keeps his message alive in our hearts. It also fulfills our duty to show gratitude to him for conveying Islam to us with patience and mercy.

sections.heading: Virtues of Salawat
sections.content: Sending salawat carries great virtues and rewards. The Prophet ﷺ said that for each salawat we send, Allah sends ten blessings upon us, removes ten sins, and raises us ten ranks in status. It is a means of drawing closer to Allah, softening the heart, and increasing love for the Prophet ﷺ. On the Day of Judgment, those who send abundant salawat will find his intercession and be among the closest to him. It brings peace and light to our lives, both in this world and the Hereafter.

sections.heading: How to Send Salawat
sections.content: Sending salawat is simple and can be done at any time. Say: 'Allahumma salli ‘ala Muhammad wa ‘ala aali Muhammad' (O Allah, send Your blessings upon Muhammad and the family of Muhammad). Include it in your daily duas, after the adhan, and especially during Salah — it is part of the Tashahhud in every prayer. Make it a habit to send salawat when you hear his name mentioned and on Fridays, which is a special time for increasing this beautiful act.

conclusion: Making salawat a regular habit brings Allah’s mercy, forgiveness, and love into our lives. May we always remember the Prophet ﷺ with gratitude and strive to follow his example in every aspect of our lives.
